page.title: 15Children's toys
page.content: The{bicycle}is the universal toy but it has undergone many changes with the taste now for{'BMX'.}A padded, strong frame, small wheels and rugged tyres make this off-street bike ideal for cross-country riding and stunts. Indoor toys see{Lego}a clear favourite with magazines and exhibitions promoting its popularity with both sexes. Board games like{Monopoly}are still favourites as are classics like {chess & marbles. Dolls}still rate highly although the emphasis is often on outfits and accessories (including cars & swimming pools!) rather than the character of the doll itself (unlike the recent{'Cabbage Patch' doll phenomenon where every doll was individual).{Video}arcade games and computerised{adventure games}compete for time with{books}(although reading may be in decline).
